alert.note: Alert for Fluvanna (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:02AM EST until January 11 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... Rivanna River At Palmyra affecting Fluvanna County. For the James River...including Palmyra...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rivanna River at Palmyra. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, River out of banks in Palmyra. Some streets closed in town as well as secondary roads leading into town. At 24.8 feet, Farmland and roads downstream flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:50 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 23.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:50 AM EST Wednesday was 23.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 7.2 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.6 feet on 02/26/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1015 PM EST.
